title: WCAS ART_HIST 370-1-1 Modern Architecture and Design

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
THESIS
Why, increasingly, do we not only let architects shape our homes and institutions, but build our cities - our whole urban environment?
What is architecture?
What are the alternatives?
What is really going on with our architectural/urban environment to begin with (and where has all the money gone)?

Part I: What is Architecture? The work of Frank Lloyd Wright and Mies van der Rohe

Part II: Who Are Architects? How did they get so powerful? How do they do their work? Why have they become so little understood (and distrusted)?

Part III: The History of Modern Architecture We Have Inherited: the Bauhaus, Le Corbusier and CIAM

Part IV: The History We Might Try to Discover: World architecture since World War II in the face of digitization.
